CatDescriptText: Mr. Carl Robinson, 81 Reed Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 19, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you think that a business recession has hit the United States? If so, how has it affected you?" answer reads: "I feel that there is a depression.  And I have been affected very badly by it and am not doing a bit good.  I haven't been doing any good for a long time."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Carl Robinson wearing hat, eyeglasses, and polka dot necktie, standing in front of brick building with sign that reads "Sale... Blinds... 2 for $4", and signs on door that read "Kahn's...", "American Beauty", and "Hickory Smoked Hams"
